review: Wow, I've been a prime member since it started, and I purchased books from amazon before it was "anything"!!! Anyway, I was offered a free trial and accepted it.  When I went to check it again after clicking to redeem it, the screen told me that I had already redeemed the offer.  Then, the next day, apparently I did not qualify for it anymore because I did not actually purchase it in my inbox.  Instead, a fire HD tablet was in my inbox!  Why the hell would the system confirm to me that the offer (the fire TV) is redeemed already for confirmation, when it hasn't been redeemed?  I was looking really looking forward to purchasing this product without the free trial, but now I'm quite pissed off at the failure of amazon to remedy such a ridiculous situation~!!!

review: So, I currently own:2x Apple TV3x Smart TV's1x ChromeTV2x Amazon Fire TV.I have disconnected Chrome and Apple from all the tv's.  I just recently ordered my third FireTv.  The streaming experience is so far above the other units, it's difficult to understand how those other brands haven't figured out a way to catch up.  I almost never have a buffering of any sort streaming movies from Amazon on this.  The Netflix experience is just as good.  I have not dug into much beyond that, but in terms of a streaming media experience, this annihilates the competition in my opinion.I also find myself using the voice function of the unit, which surprised me.  It is extremely user friendly and makes searching a snap.  This was completely unexpected.The one con for me, and this has nothing to do with Amazon or this unit, is the Bluetooth remote.  I have universal remotes for every TV (hate multiple remotes) and none of them are currently set up to handle Bluetooth only remotes.  Wish Amazon made it an option to not be Bluetooth.  Again, nothing against the unit.
